replies.message: Good question, Kathy. We will decide whether or not to activate Safety Check. If you are in the affected area, you will get a Facebook notification, see an alert at the top of your News Feed and receive an SMS from Facebook about Safety Check. Learn more about this feature here: https://www.facebook.com/about/safetycheck/. -Rose
Still don't get it have to wait for disaster then my phone will tell me???
In other word one doesn't need to get an app- it will just appear?  What about friends who are in another area and want yo check on you?

Yes Carolyn, if there is a disaster around you/in your area than Facebook will notify you and explain how to take steps from there to alert family and friends that you're okay. You don't have to do anything or change anything on your phone or fb. Facebook will alert you when you need to take action if there's a disaster.
So we leave notifying our family up to Facebook if and when they think there's a disaster in our area?
Its already active....but you will only know if there is a disaster
Utter BS. You cannot activate it. Good idea but a waste of time trying to look for connection.
My phone ran an emergency test last week , same signal and words as they are on radio.
